definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: Since mediaeval times, velar and guttural and its opening closing mouth have had many transformations.
sentences.chinese: 中古以来牙喉音及其开合口发生了许多变化。

sentences.english: Did he wantclicksand guttural sounds or something involving varying tones?
sentences.chinese: 咔哒的喉音或者混合音调？

sentences.english: Behind me Soot, my black cat, started to purr.
sentences.chinese: 我身后烟尘，我国黑猫，开始发出喉音。

sentences.english: He made a few guttural sounds.
The methods for overcoming it is to open the throat and train humming.
sentences.chinese: 克服喉音的方法主要有打开喉咙和进行哼鸣训练。

definition: pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
diction/enunciation/to pronounce the words correctly (in opera)
falsetto/opposite: natural or true voice 真聲|真声[zhen1 sheng1]
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
